result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on January 25, 2023 at 09:30 am.

9:43 AM Defendant Keijuan D Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court for Keijuan D Johnson.  Attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin. The Court calls all three co-defendant cases simultaneously at 9:42 AM. City of Waukesha Police Department Detective Jessica Behrendt sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Pitzo. Cross examination by Attorney Crawford. Redirect by Attorney Pitzo. Recross examination by Attorney Crawford. State rests. State moves for bind over with argument. Attorney Crawford objects to bind over without argument. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:17 PM Defendant Keijuan D Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court for Keijuan D Johnson. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS. Bail remains as fixed. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:18 PM Defendant Keijuan D Johnson in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.   Attorney, Amanda Nimmer, appears as friend of the court. 
Bail remains as fixed.  Public defender has not been able to appoint counsel for the defendant.  Atty. Nimmer requests an adjournment for time to appoint counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Letter regarding representation filed by SPD
Hearing on October 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:38 PM Defendant Keijuan D Johnson in court, in custody.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Keijuan D Johnson.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Attorney Herbers requests an additional status of counsel date.  Court will set for status of counsel to ensure an attorney has been appointed.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Notice Regarding United States Passport For Criminal Defendant
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on October 14, 2022.
Hearing on October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Keijuan D Johnson
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-14-2022)
Prior: 4027 N 38Th St, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with co defendants/victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) prior to being released from custody/within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

1:54 PM Defendant Keijuan D Johnson in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ricardo Tapia appears as friend of the court. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
